title: [机械]Machines —— 插件版的工业MOD？！[1.6.4]
txt_content:
本帖最后由 1582952890 于 2017-9-17 09:45 编辑 


难道以后不需要MOD也能玩工业了？！求翻译，求汉化原帖内容：  
GeneralHave you ever sat in front of a modded client and marvelled at its variety? Sadly, that comes at a price: Everyone needs to have the same mods installed before they can join a server. This plugin attempts to bring a bit of that variety into bukkit-servers by creatively using the available options to create authentic machines.ConfigurationClick me!FeaturesMachinesEach machine has its own graphical InterfaceIt is created through first placing a basic machine block (default: Emerald), and right-clicking on it with an activation Item (default: BlazeRod)You then have to craft a special Machine-Item in a designated crafting-screen, which afterwards can be inserted in the Basic Machine Block.The BMB will automatically turn into the machine that you chose it to beEvery machine will support custom upgrades which allow you to trade resources for speed (Planned)
ElectricityMachines do support electricity.They need to be connected through cable-blocks(default: Not yet chosen) to a power-storage-unit.
CustomisationAlmost everything in the plugin is fully configurable, such as crafting recipes, machine types, ...Multilang
Community InvolvementEveryone is able to create his own Machines and share them with the community.Each machine is a JAR-File which simply has to be placed into a special folder in order to be activated
Integrated MacinesWhat this obviously cannot do for youThere is no way to acutally add any new blocks or items to the game without mods. Also, machines will look like normal blocks because texturepacks cannot be dynamically changed either.PermissionsPermissionFunctionmachines.createCan a player place Machines?machines.craftingmenuCan a player open the craftingmenu in order to assemble machine-parts?machines.create.MachinenameCan a player place a machine of the type Machinenamemachines.ignoreCreateRestrictionsCan a player place any machine?Sourcehttps://github.com/dxdydxdy/MachinesSuggestionsI'm always happy to hear machine-ideas or other comments :)
